page.title: 17SHOPPING:Summary
page.content: {Shopping in North Norfolk:Summary This survey of shopping habits shows a trend away from small village shops used on a daily basis, to large supermarkets,a fact which is obviously of significance to the small trader. Present day shopping patterns are geared to convience and to finding the most competitive prices. The influence of modern technology in the home, and the effects of both men and women working, can be seen clearly in the wide range of ready-prepared foods now available. The influence of the car can also be seen:people frequently travel 10 to 15 miles from their home village to a place of work, often in a town, where large stores and supermarkets can be visited conveniently during lunch-times or on "late night opening" days.
